title-group.article-title: Fundamental Study of Single Droplet and Droplets Array Combustion with Premixed Gas

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2003 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: In the actual spray combustion fields, coupled combustion process should be occurred, between the pre-evaporate fuel component and remaining liquid droplets. Therefore it is insufficient to clarify the fundamental spray combustion mechanism with use of only droplet or only premixed mixture analyze method. In this study, the premixed mixture - droplets coupled combustion field was focused as a model of the actual spray combustion field. In the experiments, the effect of the flame pattern and the combustion rate constant by the interference between the droplets were clarified with the variation of fuels used by droplets. Besides, the effect of the premixed gas surrounding the droplets was clarified by the experiment on coupled combustion. The experiments were carried out under the normal gravity field and the micro gravity field to estimate the effect of convection in combustion field

ref.mixed-citation: J.F.Rex, A.E.Fuths, S.S. Penner, Interference Effects During Burning in Air for Stationary n- Heptane, Ethyl Alcohol, and Methyl Alcohol Droplets, Jet Propul. 26, (1956), pp.1 79-1 87
N.V.Fedoseeva, Combustion of a System of Liquid Fuel Drops, Adv. Aerosol Phys., No2, (1972), pp.1 10-1 18
Masato MIKAMI, Hideki KATO, Junichi SATO and Michikata KONO, Effect of Gravity on Interactive Combustion of Fuel Droplets, Bulletin of the JSME, 61-582 B (1995), pp-373-379
Katsuyuki KONISI, Michikata KONO, Kazuo IINUMA, Interaction Effects on the Combustion of Susperded Droplet Array, Bulletin of the JSME, 51-467 B (1985), pp-221 8-2224

Keiichi OKAI, Hideki KATO, Hiroshi ENOMOTO, Takao KANEKO, Shusuke KUNIEDA, Masato MIKAMI, Jyunichi SATO, Mitsuhiro TSUE, Michikata KONO, Pressure Effects on Interactive Combustion of Two-Bicomponent Droplets in Microgravity, Proc. 35th Symp. Combust., The combustion Institute (1997), pp.98-100
